page.title: 06KIMBERLEY BREWERY
page.content: Hardy and Hanson's Kimberley{Brewery} was formed in{1930}when Hardy's brewery joined Hanson's.From{1832}they had been competitors on opposite sides of the street,using the famous pure{ {Hollywell}springwater to make their beer.They now own approximately 200 public houses and 40 off-licences. They own{eight}acres of land,{four and {a half}of which are occupied by the brewery.They supply the counties of{ {Nottinghamshire,Derbyshire}and some of {Lincolnshire,Leicestershire and South {Yorkshire.}The company has been very successful at Brewers' Exhibitions and in{1929,1931}and{1935}won the Challenge Cup for the best bottled beer.In{1952}and{1968}they won the Gold Medal as runner-up for the best draught beer.The brewery is still a family business.It employs 100 people.
